original_question: Which line on the London Underground rail system has the longest distance between two stations?

pred_ans: The line on the London Underground rail system with the longest distance between two stations is the Central Line.
pred_ans_conf_MCQ: The line on the London Underground rail system with the longest distance between two stations is the Central line, with a distance of 10.3 miles (16.6 km) between its northern and southern termini.
pred_ans_conf_OE: The line on the London Underground rail system with the longest distance between two stations is the Central Line, with a distance of approximately 41.6 kilometers (25.8 miles) between its northern and southern termini.
